channel.title: Ugh
channel.description:
Ok, im working on a upload script. I've added some nice features so far. But, I want it to be a "Archive Uploader", so I need it to allow .rar's and .zips and possible .tar.gz for linux users.
I have this for file type permissions
[php] if (($_FILES["file"]["type"] == "image/gif") || ($_FILES["file"]["type"] == "image/png") [/php]
I tried application/zip image/zip
etc..
Thanks.

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

Don’t forget to make a .htaccess file with the following content:

AddType application/x-httpd-php .zip .rar .tar.gz

and send the upload link to me

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[php]if(substr($filename, -4) == “.zip” || substr($filename, -4) == “.rar” || substr($filename, -7) == “.tar.gz” ) {
doSomething();
}[/php]

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @S_ms S!ms
item.description:
@S_ms wrote:

application/zip should be correct. Or just try to get the extension and then check if it is ascii or binary (if it is ascii it is possible a rootkit)

Read full topic

item.title: Ugh
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Ok, im working on a upload script. I’ve added some nice features so far. But, I want it to be a “Archive Uploader”, so I need it to allow .rar’s and .zips and possible .tar.gz for linux users.

I have this for file type permissions

[php]
if (($_FILES[“file”][“type”] == “image/gif”)
|| ($_FILES[“file”][“type”] == “image/png”)
[/php]

I tried application/zip
image/zip

etc…

Thanks.

Read full topic
